channel.title: Popcast
channel.description: New York Times music critics Jon Pareles and Jon Caramanica talk each week about the latest pop music news, the top songs, the best albums, the biggest stars — and the up and coming stars you haven't heard of yet.
channel.itunes:author: The New York Times
channel.itunes:summary: New York Times music critics Jon Pareles and Jon Caramanica talk each week about the latest pop music news, the top songs, the best albums, the biggest stars — and the up and coming stars you haven't heard of yet.

item.title: Katy Perry, Lorde and Halsey: How to Make a Pop Album in 2017
item.description: Three female pop stars, three different approaches: a conversation about their new albums, on Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: Three female pop stars, three different approaches: a conversation about their new albums, on Popcast.

item.title: Why We’re Still Listening to the Beatles’ ‘Sgt. Pepper’
item.description: Our pop music critics are not fans of record anniversaries, but 50 years after the creation of “Sgt. Pepper,” there are still lessons to be learned from the album.
item.itunes:summary: Our pop music critics are not fans of record anniversaries, but 50 years after the creation of “Sgt. Pepper,” there are still lessons to be learned from the album.

item.title: Latin Pop Thrives, No Bieber Required
item.description: “Despacito” is the first Spanish-language song to top the chart since “Macarena,” but there are many more interesting shifts in Latin pop today.
item.itunes:summary: “Despacito” is the first Spanish-language song to top the chart since “Macarena,” but there are many more interesting shifts in Latin pop today.

item.title: Festivals That Inspire Awe, and Festivals That Lead to Criminal Investigations
item.description: Music fests are ubiquitous, but only some are curated well enough to be thrilling. And there’s the Fyre Festival.
item.itunes:summary: Music fests are ubiquitous, but only some are curated well enough to be thrilling. And there’s the Fyre Festival.

item.title: Harry Styles and John Mayer, Teardrops on Their Guitars
item.description: The One Direction member and the pop-blues poster boy have a few things in common.
item.itunes:summary: The One Direction member and the pop-blues poster boy have a few things in common.

item.title: Paramore Returns, Headed Straight For the 1980s
item.description: One of the most impressive rock bands working in the mainstream has taken a left turn. Where is Paramore headed, and how did it inspire scores of artists?
item.itunes:summary: One of the most impressive rock bands working in the mainstream has taken a left turn. Where is Paramore headed, and how did it inspire scores of artists?

item.title: Finding Feist’s Pleasure and Pain
item.description: The singer-songwriter’s new album is a low-fi exploration of extreme emotions. How does it relate to her earlier hits, and how did she get here?
item.itunes:summary: The singer-songwriter’s new album is a low-fi exploration of extreme emotions. How does it relate to her earlier hits, and how did she get here?

item.title: How Lil Uzi Vert Turned Rap Into Rock and Became a Pop Star
item.description: He’s a rapper, a social media phenomenon, the guy yelling “ya” on Migos’s hit “Bad and Boujee.” What’s the secret of Uzi’s success?
item.itunes:summary: He’s a rapper, a social media phenomenon, the guy yelling “ya” on Migos’s hit “Bad and Boujee.” What’s the secret of Uzi’s success?

item.title: A Deep Dig on Kendrick Lamar and J. Cole’s Hip-Hop’s Values
item.description: The two rappers recall an earlier time in the genre’s history, in terms of aesthetics and politics. How do they fit in today?
item.itunes:summary: The two rappers recall an earlier time in the genre’s history, in terms of aesthetics and politics. How do they fit in today?

item.title: How Do You Solve a Problem Like the Chainsmokers?
item.description: In three years, the duo has had several hits while offending all sorts of people. What does its sound say about EDM?
item.itunes:summary: In three years, the duo has had several hits while offending all sorts of people. What does its sound say about EDM?

item.title: Jazz in 2017: The Music Is Thriving, Though Support Is in Peril
item.description: Kamasi Washington and some Los Angeles musicians are producing vital recordings, but N.E.A. funding is uncertain. A conversation about the state of jazz.
item.itunes:summary: Kamasi Washington and some Los Angeles musicians are producing vital recordings, but N.E.A. funding is uncertain. A conversation about the state of jazz.

item.title: Drake Changed Hip-Hop’s Sound. Can He Change the Business?
item.description: His release isn’t an album or a mixtape, but a playlist — a move that could position him to shift the music industry once again.
item.itunes:summary: His release isn’t an album or a mixtape, but a playlist — a move that could position him to shift the music industry once again.

item.title: How Chuck Berry Became a Rock ’n’ Roll Mastermind
item.description: He wrote the guitar licks, told the clever stories, duckwalked across the stage and forever changed popular music
item.itunes:summary: He wrote the guitar licks, told the clever stories, duckwalked across the stage and forever changed popular music

item.title: The Billboard Charts Are Wackier Than Ever: What’s Going On?
item.description: Streaming figures into chart positions now, a fact that has started yielding some very odd results.
item.itunes:summary: Streaming figures into chart positions now, a fact that has started yielding some very odd results.

item.title: The Greatest Trick Ed Sheeran Ever Pulled Was Convincing the World He’s an Underdog
item.description: The British singer/songwriter is a record-smashing superstar, but he still plays the spurned lover. How does he do it?
item.itunes:summary: The British singer/songwriter is a record-smashing superstar, but he still plays the spurned lover. How does he do it?

item.title: What Future and Migos Tell Us About Atlanta’s Rap Dominance
item.description: A panel discusses Migos, Lil Yachty and more of the city’s budding stars on Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: A panel discusses Migos, Lil Yachty and more of the city’s budding stars on Popcast.

item.title: What Happens When Nashville Outsiders Become Country’s Big Stars?
item.description: The city synonymous with the country music business is in transition. How is it dealing with rapid change, and the Trump era? A panel discusses on Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: The city synonymous with the country music business is in transition. How is it dealing with rapid change, and the Trump era? A panel discusses on Popcast.

item.title: Were There Any Real Winners at the Grammys?
item.description: It was an awards show filled with flubs, tear, apologies and protests. The New York Times pop music writers discuss Adele, Beyoncé, Chance the Rapper and more on Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: It was an awards show filled with flubs, tear, apologies and protests. The New York Times pop music writers discuss Adele, Beyoncé, Chance the Rapper and more on Popcast.

item.title: Will the Grammy Awards End With a Big Surprise?
item.description: The New York Times pop team debates whether Sturgill Simpson will pull out a surprise victory in a night stacked with Adele vs. Beyoncé face-offs.
item.itunes:summary: The New York Times pop team debates whether Sturgill Simpson will pull out a surprise victory in a night stacked with Adele vs. Beyoncé face-offs.

item.title: Punk Rock Is Alive and Well, No Politics Required
item.description: The current political climate doesn’t come up even once during the latest Popcast, a conversation about Japandroids, the Menzingers and the state of rock.
item.itunes:summary: The current political climate doesn’t come up even once during the latest Popcast, a conversation about Japandroids, the Menzingers and the state of rock.

item.title: The War Over ‘La La Land’: Gotta Hear Both Sides
item.description: The toast of Hollywood has divided our culture writers. Two of the movie’s boosters go to battle with two of its critics in this week’s Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: The toast of Hollywood has divided our culture writers. Two of the movie’s boosters go to battle with two of its critics in this week’s Popcast.

item.title: The Crooner in Chief: Barack Obama’s Musical Legacy
item.description: He brought soul and hip-hop into the White House like no president before him. A discussion of Mr. Obama’s most powerful musical moments, on this week’s Popcast.
item.itunes:summary: He brought soul and hip-hop into the White House like no president before him. A discussion of Mr. Obama’s most powerful musical moments, on this week’s Popcast.

item.title: Hip-Hop’s Elders and Youth Go to Battle (Again)
item.description: Should rap’s young stars have more reverence for the genre’s pioneers, and vice versa? A conversation about hip-hop’s latest generation-gap struggles.
item.itunes:summary: Should rap’s young stars have more reverence for the genre’s pioneers, and vice versa? A conversation about hip-hop’s latest generation-gap struggles.

item.title: Mariah Carey and New Year’s Eve: Is the Fantasy Over?
item.description: A panel discusses Ms. Carey's recent New Year's Eve performance and career.
item.itunes:summary: A panel discusses Ms. Carey's recent New Year's Eve performance and career.

item.title: 10 Songs That Tell the Story of 2016
item.description: A round table of pop experts discuss the year in tracks, from Maren Morris's "Rich" to Twenty One Pilots' "Ride" to Rihanna's "Sex With Me."
item.itunes:summary: A round table of pop experts discuss the year in tracks, from Maren Morris's "Rich" to Twenty One Pilots' "Ride" to Rihanna's "Sex With Me."

item.title: The Year in Jazz Music
item.description: A roundtable of writers discuss trends and notable moments of the year.
item.itunes:summary: A roundtable of writers discuss trends and notable moments of the year.

item.title: Pop Music Trends in 2016
item.description: The pop music team discusses news themes and what may shape it for years to come.
item.itunes:summary: The pop music team discusses news themes and what may shape it for years to come.

item.title: The Best Albums of 2016
item.description: This week, The New York Times music team reflects on albums that defined 2016.
item.itunes:summary: This week, The New York Times music team reflects on albums that defined 2016.

item.title: For Bruno Mars and the Weeknd, the Past as Muse
item.description: This week, a discussion of new releases by both artists who have more in common than it may appear.
item.itunes:summary: This week, a discussion of new releases by both artists who have more in common than it may appear.

item.title: Revisiting Kanye West's 'The Life of Pablo'
item.description: After a series of bizarre shows, Kanye West canceled the remainder of his "Saint Pablo" tour last week. This weekend, we're listening back to the conversation Jon Caramanica led at the time of the album's release.
item.itunes:summary: After a series of bizarre shows, Kanye West canceled the remainder of his "Saint Pablo" tour last week. This weekend, we're listening back to the conversation Jon Caramanica led at the time of the album's release.

item.title: Mourning the Greats: Leonard Cohen, Leon Russell and Mose Allison
item.description: This year has seen the loss of Prince, David Bowie, Merle Haggard, and, now, three more towering figures have died. A look at their legacies.
item.itunes:summary: This year has seen the loss of Prince, David Bowie, Merle Haggard, and, now, three more towering figures have died. A look at their legacies.
